for later when I add on more bar before gluing on the back I flatten the

cork let's see how it goes as you can see I cut the pieces at an angle so that
they look like jagged formations of stone that stick out from the earth
there are generous amounts of extra glue put on smaller pieces and even sprinkled
on the tiny stuff that breaks off while cutting
to make this extra durable I added concerning amounts of PVA glue at the

will have to dry for a while so come back tomorrow the glue has now dried and
the bark seems to stay in place great I mixed black paint PVA glue and a

into all of the tricky parts of the bark I made sure there were no naked areas on
the bark all right the base coat has now tried I will start

here I had a moderate amount of paint on the brush while trying to get paint on

while at it I decided to paint some small areas almost fully brown then in a

perhaps this will look like different layers who knows anyway it starts
looking quite interesting I continued by painting individual areas
with a tan I think this will contribute well to the layered and random stone
look
there we go I think this is ready to be drybrushed I Drive rushed everything

build here I noticed a few other surfaces that

the base and the Titan are prime examples of what I like to do on this
